casename: Tong Keng Meng v Inno-Pacific Holdings Ltd and Another
counsel: Desmond Ong and Prakash Mulani (J Koh & Co) for the plaintiff; Chan Kok Chye (Infinitus Law Corp) for the first defendant; Thio Ying Ying (Kelvin Chia Partnership) for the second defendant
tags-parsed: Companies/Oppression/Conduct amounting to oppression/Voting/Extraordinary general meeting/Proxy casting votes on behalf of member of company contrary to member's directions/Garnering support through proxy forms to advance one's intention/Whether proxy exercising dominant power/Whether proxy acting oppressively/Whether proxy owes contractual obligation or fiduciary duty to member/s 216(1) Companies Act (Cap 50, 1994 Ed)
